msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra; headings and incipits of the texts; directives for the ministers; most of the abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs and Ethiopic numerals.
Text on fol. 5r is written alternately in red and black lines.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 62.0 folios, of which 3.0 blank, in 9.0 quires.
21.5 16.5 6.0

list.item: 4 VII(4/s. l.: 1, 4, stubs before 1 and after 4/fols. 55r-58v)

4 VIII(4/fols. 59r-62v).
Quire A includes a bifolio ("rejected leaves") originating from a different, much older Ms.

supportDesc.condition: The original sewing is partly missing, substituted for with the recent synthetic threads.

layout.ab: average number; actual numbers vary from 22 to 24
Ruling is partly visible, pricking is not visible.
Ruling pattern cannot be established with certainty.

handDesc.handNote:
Mediocre but by well-trained hand. Black; reddish-brown Wäldä MuseAccordin to Additio 3, ʾabunä Wäldä Muse is the scribe.Late 19th cent.
(ይ)ካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካህን፡
(ይ)ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡
(ይ)ሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡
አ፡ አ፡ አ፡ for አሜን፡ አሜን፡ አሜን፡ (s. fol. 45va)

decoDesc.decoNote: - Fol. 5r: Two crudely drawn coloured (red, black) ornamental bands over cols. a-b, at the incipit of Text I.

span.style: line-height: 115%; font-family:

item.p: The text can be used as the ʾanbǝro ʾǝd of the Anaphora of St. John the Son of Thunder and the ḫadafe näfs of the Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom. The first of these Anaphoras is absent from the Ms., the corresponding part of the second does not contain this text. The omitted text may have been written out separately. Written in a single column.

item.p: “Rejected leaves” originating from an older Ms., occasionally included into MR-014b. Text includes scriptural readings (Acts 16:25-34; Mt 25:1-13) as well as mentions of an ʾanbǝro ʾǝd and a creed (without the texts). Old, fine handwriting (not later than the 15th cent.). Supplication formulas mention priest Gäbrä Krǝstos (possibly the owner of the Ms. from which these folios were taken).

p.span: Fol. 61rb: This Missal belongs to (the church of) Qǝddus Mika

span.style: line-height: 115%; font-family:
line-height: 115%; font-family:

p.span: el in ˀAdḥǝyaw. He who bought it for his own money and he who wrote it is ˀabunä Wäldä Muse, for ever and ever. Amen.

item.p: The Ms. originates from the church of Qǝddus Mikaʾel in ʾAdḥǝyaw (ʿAd Ḥǝyaw?), but its current location is the chruch of Śǝllase Mǝdrä Ruba.

list.item: - Fol. 1r, 1v: Crude notes, poorly visible. - Fol. 51v (in the upper margin): Crude note. - Fol. 60vb: Supplication formula mentions ʾabunä Ṣäware Mäsqäl, possibly the head of the local church community at the time of the writing of the Ms. - Fols. 62r, 62v: Crude notes.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards; Two pairs of sewing stations.

origin.origDate: The scribe ʾabunä Wäldä Muse was a contemporary of King Yoḥannǝs IV (r. 1872-89). A bifolio included in quire A originate from a different, 15th-cent. manuscript.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
